DOCNAME: CASE OF DİRİ DIRI v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Criminal proceedings;Article 6-2 - Presumption of innocence)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He used to work as a security guard in a security van for ORG , a private bank in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE , on their return from CARDINAL of the branches of the bank , the applicant and his CARDINAL colleagues working in the same van realised that a sum of money ( approximately MONEY ) was missing .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was questioned by the police and on DATE the ORG prosecutor filed an indictment formally charging the applicant and his CARDINAL colleagues with the offence of breach of trust .

CARDINAL . On DATE , while the criminal proceedings against the applicant and his colleagues were in progress , Law No . DATE entered into force . Law No . DATE provides for the suspension of criminal cases in respect of certain offences committed before DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG considered the following :

“ ... [ the applicant ] has committed the offence of breach of trust . Nevertheless , the offence was committed before DATE and it thus falls within the ambit of LAW . DATE . It is accordingly decided not to convict [ the applicant ] but to suspend the proceedings in accordance with LAW . CARDINAL ”
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed against ORG decision , arguing that if the proceedings had not been postponed his innocence would have been proved .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided that ORG decision was not appealable because it was not a decision containing a definitive conclusion . It considered , however , that the applicant ’s appeal could be examined as an “ objection ” and forwarded it to ORG prosecutor for the necessary action to be taken .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG examined the objection and rejected it .

CARDINAL . On DATE lawyers representing ORG lodged a claim with ORG for the return of the missing money from the applicant and the CARDINAL colleagues who had been working with him on DATE it went missing .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered the applicant and his CARDINAL colleagues to repay the missing money to the bank together with the “ highest rates of interest applicable ” . It considered , on the basis of ORG decision of DATE , that the applicant and his colleagues had “ committed the offence ” in question and embezzled the money . The applicant appealed against the decision and drew ORG attention to the fact that he had not been convicted of any offence by ORG , which , in fact , had decided to suspend the proceedings .

CARDINAL . ORG quashed the decision in so far as it concerned the rate of interest applicable . On DATE ORG decided , in line with ORG decision , that a lower rate of interest should apply . An appeal lodged against that decision by the applicant was rejected by ORG on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s contract of employment was terminated by his employer . The applicant and his CARDINAL colleagues brought a case against the bank before ORG claiming compensation for their dismissal .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s claim for compensation for his dismissal . It stated as follows :

“ The case concerns the compensation claim for the dismissal of the plaintiffs who worked for the respondent bank and who , instead of bringing [ a sum of ] money they had collected from CARDINAL of the bank ’s branches back to their branch of the bank , embezzled it ... According to ORG decision of DATE , the plaintiffs committed the offence of breach of trust that the proceedings were suspended in accordance with Law No . DATE ... ”

CARDINAL . The applicant appealed against the decision , arguing that the criminal proceedings against him had been suspended by ORG . He further argued that the proper course of action for ORG would have been to collect its own evidence , hear witnesses , and reach its conclusion on the basis of that evidence .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed ORG decision of DATE . It held that ORG decision had suspended the proceedings and not convicted the applicant . ORG had erred in rejecting the applicant ’s claim without hearing any of the witnesses proposed by him or obtaining expert reports , or even examining ORG case file .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG reiterated its decision of DATE . In the opinion of ORG , the applicant had caused financial losses to the bank by embezzling the money and knew that his employment had been terminated because of that . Any expectation on the part of the applicant of receiving compensation for his dismissal would therefore damage confidence in the judiciary and , for that reason , ORG could not adhere to ORG decision of CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE an appeal lodged by the applicant against ORG decision was rejected by ORG , which considered that ORG decision was in accordance with its decision of CARDINAL DATE . This decision was communicated to the applicant on DATE .
CARDINAL . Law No . DATE , in so far as relevant , provides as follows :
“ CARDINAL . In respect of offences committed before DATE which are punishable by a maximum prison sentence of DATE :
- where no criminal investigation has been commenced or no indictment has been filed , institution of prosecution shall be suspended ;

- where the criminal prosecution has reached the final stages but no definitive finding on the merits has been adopted or where a definitive finding on the merits has not yet become final , adoption of a definitive finding on the merits shall be suspended .
If the person concerned is detained on remand , he or she shall be released . Documents and evidence concerning such offences shall be kept until the statute of limitations has been reached .

In cases where an offence of the same kind or an offence which is punishable by a more severe prison sentence has been committed before the statute of limitations has been reached , a new prosecution shall be brought in respect of the previous offence which was the subject matter of the suspension or the suspended proceedings shall be resumed . If no offences of the same kind or an offence which is punishable by a more severe prison sentence has been committed before the statute of limitations has been reached , no public prosecutions may be brought against those who benefited from the suspension and the suspended proceedings shall be permanently terminated .
